intro: Podanthes pulchra var. major, commonly known as the Giant Podanthes, is a striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
